articles.headline: Data exposes avian deaths
articles.summary: James Bruggers investigates avian deaths caused by wind turbines in Northern California, revealing the extent and species impacted, and discusses industry efforts to reduce these incidents.

articles.headline: SEJ homepage now located at www.reporter.org
articles.summary: Russell Clemings announces the relocation of the Society of Environmental Journalists' website to the IRE/NICAR server, outlining plans for new online services and resources for environmental journalism.

articles.headline: What toxins are wafting your way?
articles.summary: Greg Reeves discusses the usefulness of the EPA's Toxic Release Inventory database in uncovering pollution by analyzing company-reported emissions of chemicals into various environments.

articles.headline: CAR helps catch big fish story
articles.summary: Dan Kim covers how Mark Schleifstein and his team used computer-assisted reporting to investigate the overfishing and environmental impacts on the Gulf of Mexico and worldwide fisheries.

articles.headline: Data makes INS sweat
articles.summary: April Lynch writes about using Paradox database to analyze INS records, uncovering how the INS lets employers who hire undocumented workers evade penalties.

articles.headline: Students beat odds
articles.summary: Anastasia Hendrix and Russell Clemings analyze CLAS scores, discovering students from poorer backgrounds outperforming expectations in Fresno, California.
